intro: Diphyes ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf diphyes, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
